Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: watersteeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as we wanted te be near the Concertgebouw as we were visiting a concert there. Its a 5 min walk. Hotel right around the corner of PC Hooftstraat, the! shopping street of Amsterdam, Other side: Vondelpark. The hotel is near centre of town, you can go there walking. Also all big museums are walking distance. And dontforget to go to Lodsh, interior shop. Hotel 3-4 star, breakfast good, rooms good, also garden with seating and lounge corner. Hotel offers no lunch/dinner, why should it, just walk out and go anywhere. Has a very nice bar, free wifi and even free to use desktop pc's. Staff; friendly and helpful. Tip: for serinity and quietness: teahouse "de roos", located in Vondelpark. 5 min walking.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for business/holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: 2ontheroadCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Piet Hein worked perfectly for our stay for a business/holiday trip of 5 nights. It is located next to the major city park, so the surrounding area is tranquil but also convenient to the museums and to very nice shops and restaurants. It's an easy walk to a major square (Leidseplein) where you can catch a tram to the center. However, it's also easy to walk the 15 minutes to the center. The staff is helpful and all speak excellent English. The better rooms are in the NEW part of the building, so be sure to ask for that side. Also, the deluxe rooms are worth the extra charge. Rooms are modern in design and a decent size, especially for Europe. Breakfast is extra at E15 - hot and cold food. Better to go to nearby bakery or the Bagel and Bean cafe for good breakfast for E8-10. I would definitely recommend the Piet Hein Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What's good is great, what isn't is average”
Reviews.Author: HepAdvisor
Reviews.Content: This is a tough place to review. In all, if you seek this location and don't drive, consider the Piet Hein and book it online to save money and include breakfast, which I didn't have. There is something about the atmosphere that is inviting, especially the location, lobby, lighting, and service--and none of the narrow steps common to Amsterdam. The Piet Hein is on top of Vondel Park, the museums, good bakeries, and pretty good restaurants. Parking (and driving) are an Amsterdam disaster: bikers rule, costs are high (4 Euros/nearly $6 per hour) and tickets are frequent. You'd be wise to park at the Olympic Stadium for 8 Euros/day and tram 10 minutes (free) back/forth to the hotel. Americans will find rooms typically European smallish and dimly lit amidst the wave of "green" initiatives. Room decor and color are unexciting. Furnishings are typically sparse: a fair-sized table-desk & chair, a small vanity "closet" with a handful of hangers and a safe, and two small night tables. Some rooms have space for a small chair. Beds are comfy and low to the ground unless you upgrade to a higher, debateably oversoft bed. I was invited to compare rooms before choosing--typical of the excellent 24/7 service. Bathrooms are clean and compact with excellent water pressure and hot water--and the troublesome European moving shower head on a rail that faces out and sprays the curtain (and floor) barring extra caution. Counter space is so-so. WiFi is very come & go. The two lobby computers are often open and work well. Typical of mid-priced continental Europe, expect no extras such as a tram map, microwave, mini-fridge, tissues, or TV instruction or line-up, though the TV is good with many channels. It's a likeable, if limited, hotel in a good location of a unique city.

Reviews.Title: “A big no , really surprised by good reviews”
Reviews.Author: klm_scotland
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel , it does not have a restaurant . It is a Bed and Breakfast if you are a student or back packer you may like it as very clean. But bring a jumper !! + Staff + Entrance and public area +Clean - No Heating - No Restaurant - Shower not working - No minbar - No drinking water in room - Bathroom paper dispenser from public loos, Yuk - Shampoo in plastic dispenser on walls , yuk !!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattyboyLeiden
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight and found the hotel to be absolutely fine, very good location, quiet rooms and a good breakfast. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location with a helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: AdSchu
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience with Hotel Piet Hein! At check-in, we were cheerfully greeted by Nora, who was swift, efficient and friendly. She offered us a map of the city and to answer any questions we may have. It was a great first impression! Later, we interacted with Martin, who was just great. He was very outgoing, offered great suggestions for us first-time visitors and made reservations for us at a wonderful restaurant. Our room was quite nice. The contemporary nautical decor was pleasant and well-coordinated. Everything was in great shape and functioned flawlessly. The bathroom was small, but quite adequate. We are cold-natured, so I loved that we could open the windows to regulate the room's temperature. Had we not been able to open the windows, it may have been too warm. I suppose that suggests the heater worked well too. The only non-positive comment I have about our room was that the "queen" bed was actually composed of two pushed-together twin beds. This arrangement is awkward for those who like to sleep close to their significant other because the beds wouldn't stay together... Not a major problem, but one that detracted from our overall experience. We thought the hotel's breakfast was perfect. The food and drink offerings were excellent and varied, and the room in which it was staged was quite clean and pleasant. The staff who tended to the breakfast were attentive and diligent. Their breakfast was a great start to a long day of walking and sightseeing! Service at Hotel Piet Hein was excellent. There were several occasions where I called down for extra towels and they had them at my door in less than ten minutes every time. We once called down for hot water for tea and they brought up an electric carafe with tea cups, sugar, and spoons. That was more than we asked for and I thought it was great. Every person with whom we interacted at the front desk or in the breakfast room was fantastic. It was clear to me that they gave the comfort of their guest a high priority. As first-time visitors to Amsterdam, we weren't sure about the location, but it turned out to be a great one... Right by the peaceful Vondelpark and a short walk to the Leidseplein. It's a great comfort to know that when we visit Amsterdam again, we already know which hotel at which we'll stay... Piet Hein!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JoTg
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the location of the hotel. It is very close to Van Gogh museum, several eateries (Hard Rock Cafe, Wagamama), a supermarket and a mecca of luxurious boutiques and high street shops. You can even choose to walk to the old town instead of taking the public transport once you got yourself familiarised with directions to and from the hotel. The hotel reception area certainly has a 4 star feel to it - clean and sleek. Not so sure about the room that I stayed in though. The furniture in the room looks old and tired. The heating in the room was weak. I was left feeling cold at night. The bedroom and bathroom could have been cleaner. I found strands of hair sticking on the wall in the bathroom from day I checked in and they were still there on the day I checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: JosephODonoghue
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam a few times now, and lived there earlier in the year. I've therefore had to find accommodation for friends who come to visit me when I was working there - and this weekend also for myself. I really liked this hotel. Amsterdam is famous for its expensive accommodation. This hotel is in such a perfect location and is nice and quiet, and also value for money. The rooms are modern, recently decorated, though not very large. The bathroom was clean and contemporary etc. I had to ask to change rooms, as I was placed right next to the bar. But that was the only hiccup. The breakfast is included and generous as far as European breakfasts go (think Paris where you're lucky to get a croissant!). The bar is warm and cosy and you step straight out onto Vondel Park. I'd definitely continue to stay here, and also recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected stay in conveniently placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: sietie
Reviews.Content: As the room I had reserved in my original hotel, was double booked, I was kindly put up by the Hotel Piet Hein instead. I arrived late in the evening and only stayed one night, so can only judge the room and the breakfast. The room was clean but small with no view to speak of. It had an appropriate nautical theme since the hotel was named after Piet Hein, a famous Dutch admiral who conquered the Spanish silver fleet in 1628. The furniture consisted of a roomy bed, narrow table, narrow wardrobe and chair; there were no bedside tables. The bathroom had a comfortable bath and was very clean. It had a hair dryer but no accessories like bars of soap or little bottles of shampoo etc, only two liquid soap dispensers, shower cap and shoe polish and plastic cup. The wardrobe contained a portable safe and luggage stand and several hangers. The sheet covering the mattress was too small and could not be tucked in properly. For a longer stay this room might be too Spartan. The breakfast was excellent with crunchy croissants, warm boiled and scrambled eggs, cheese, different kinds of bread, tomatoes, yoghurt, fresh fruit salad and good coffee. The service at reception and in the breakfast room was very friendly. The location of the hotel is excellent in a peaceful, superior part of Amsterdam. It is beautifully situated along the Vondelpark, named after the most famous Dutch poet and playwright of the 17th century. The Vossiusstraat runs parallel to the PC Hooftstraat, one of the most fashionable shopping streets in Amsterdam. The Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum are only a short walk away, and the Concertgebouw is around the corner in the Van Baerlestraat. CafÃ© Americain with its beautiful Art Deco interior is just across the canal near the famous Leidseplein. Transport facilities in this area are extremely efficient. Bus 197 goes directly from outside Schiphol airport to the Leidseplein in 20 minutes, with the stop Museumplein just opposite the Concertgebouw. Trams 5 and 2 take you to and from the Central Station. Canal cruises leave from Stadhouderskade, a few minutes from the hotel. Considering that I only paid 95 euros including breakfast, I think this hotel provides excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise”
Reviews.Author: Manoela M
Reviews.Content: Its a lovely hotel and great value for money. The lounge with the bar and the computers is really cosy and makes the guest feel at home. The room is comfortable and clean.The staff is REALLY friendly and helpful. I ended up at Piet Hein after my previous hotel canceled my reservation a few days before my arrival in Amsterdam, so I did not know what to expect. But I can assure that Piet Hein was really really a pleasent surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality hotel, convenient location, very good value for money. You can't request more.”
Reviews.Author: Petrita99
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review in the hotel bar area, drinking a nice tea served by friendly hotel staff. I was upgraded to double room for free, without even asking. I got a room with really big window, terrace and amazing view. There is a coffee table and two chairs so I can imagine myself having a drink there (not now in late November tho). You can rely on pictures from the hotel website. It looks exactly like that - clean and with pleasant atmosphere. It is also conveniently located near all museums and big green park. Very good value for money. The taxi from the main train station cost 20 Euros. Next time I am in Amsterdam I will stay here again and I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sujoydas
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely hotel situated next to Vondel park a lovely green park right in the middle of the city.All the musueums and the entertainment ares are very close to this hotel.Has a lovely bar though lacks a 24 hr restuarant. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We so enjoyed Hotel Piet Hein!!”
Reviews.Author: WestTenn_
Reviews.Content: While traveling with another couple in September 2011, had our first visit to Amsterdam. We selected this hotel based on internet information and some guide book recommendations. We were a little nervous about our impression that Amsterdam would be so loud, boisterous - maybe a bit overwhelming. This hotel was a fabulous surprise. Just across the street from a lovely park (Vondelpark), and close to museum area, it was a great experience. There were several good restaurants within walking distance (good recommendations from hotel staff). At the end of the block, we boarded our canal-boat tour (with discount coupon from hotel). Room was nice, with view of attractive courtyard. Was not large, but fine based on European standards. Lobby was very pleasant and comfortable. The bar area was like a friendly community at the end of the day .... the bartender / host Martin was an immediate friend, and helpful consierge as well - the friendly "face" of the hotel. Breakfast buffet was great. We would choose this hotel again if returning to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: travelfiend_30
Reviews.Content: Good location, central but in a quiet street - 5 mins to Leidesplein. Nice service, clean and modern hotel. Small rooms as is usually the case with hotels located in old residential buildings, but overall it is pleasant, clean and nice. My sheets were a little torn, which isn't great. Other than that - all good.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: danwhitaker
Reviews.Content: business-friendly hotel, in lovely location on a quiet street by vondelpark and museums. basic rooms, friendly bar and staff, internet access and available computers. note: best prices through calling directly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Hotel Piet Hein Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: vyelena
Reviews.Content: Great location (central, but quiet), near the entrance to the Vondelpark, couple of minutes walk to the Museumplain and Leidseplein. Simple walk to the city center. Shopping area, restaurants and bars are also very close to the hotel. The hotel itself is well designed with nice bar and lounge. Free internet access. Very nice, helpful and English-speaking stuff that tried to do everything to make our stay comfortable. We'll definitely return to the hotel on our next visit in Amsterdam!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Volga981
Reviews.Content: Perfect professional service, the rooms are extremely clean and nice. The only downside: small rooms. I believe by bed did not have a headboard just because it would not fit. The room (single) was probably 5 square meters.

Reviews.Title: “All I want to do is take a shower”
Reviews.Author: moravec
Reviews.Content: After arriving from a flight from the USA, where a clumsy flight attendant spilled red wine all over me, all I want to do is take a shower and wash it all off. Unfortunately, I arrived at the hotel a little bit early, and I am not permitted to check in until precisely the appointed time (rules are rules, you know). So, as I wait, I will write a review of the lobby: If you like dirty furniture, house flies and mosquitos, this is the place for you! If you think dust bunnies hanging from the ceiling are classy, you'll love this place! If you want WIFI that firewalls you from doing any actual work, you'll dig the retro-productivity of Hotel Piet Hein! That said, the staff seem friendly. I can't wait until one of them allows me to take a shower!

Reviews.Title: “I am coming again!!”
Reviews.Author: Hoodstar1
Reviews.Content: This was my best stay in a hotel ever. I was in Amsterdam for buiseness and i need a quite hotel - but i never thought it would so enjoyable. This hotel should have 5stars! The stuff, rooms, every single thing is excellent!i will come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another successful Amsterdam IBC trip”
Reviews.Author: stevenma
Reviews.Content: I've attended the IBC (International Broadcast Conference & Exhibition) which takes place at the major RAI convention site for over 10 years and stayed in a number of hotels and in one case an apartment and another a University type hall. Hotels around IBC are generally expensive and get booked up very quickly. Hotel Piet Hein was recommended to me by a colleague around three years ago and I managed to book in last year, 2010 and made an advance booking for 2011. This year I booked for 5 nights but shared them with a colleague as I could only stay 2 nights Thursday & Friday. Last year I was in a very nice twin room at the front of the hotel on I think the second floor but this year in what appeared to be a relatively new single room at the rear overlooking the open patio. Both rooms were quiet; the hotel is just off the main street and I enjoyed good nights sleep on both occasions. (I do wish other guests could be a bit more considerate and not let their doors slam particularly late at night. It's not the doors by the way it's the guests!) I take B&B and the breakfast room is clean and efficient. The two or three friendly ladies appeared to be the same as in 2010 and actually bake the croisants & other rolls fresh. I normally have cereal and fruit but they have cooked and cheeses & ham too. There's no evening restaurant but the two nearby restaurants recommended to me have been excellent; this year it was the very good 'non-tourist) Pepper & Zout (Salt!) about five minutes walk away. The other was one of Amsterdam's best again 'non-tourist' steak houses about ten minutes walk away - also recommended to me by some Dutch friends. I've forgotten it's name but the Piet Hein receptionist will tell you. There is a friendly, vibrant bar which I used on both nights actually for a cup of Earl Grey tea before bed! There is free guest wifi which worked in my room(s) but on my iPhone I found it slightly frustrating as, unless your phone is doing something, it tended to forget the connection and you had to re-logon. I also found that I had to use the Gmail Safari page rather than the iPhone app possibily due to the hotel protecting their (& your) network security. There are also 4 good PCs in the bar / lobby area which I also made use of and never saw them all in use. If you're attending the RAI you can walk it in good weather in about 25mins or get to the centre of Amsterdam in around the same time or less dependent on where you're going. Equally, if you want somewhere nice to stay with a friend or partner it makes an excellent choice. All in all another excellent stay which I plan to repeat next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Jingerella
Reviews.Content: We've chosen this hotel mainly due to it's location and air-conditioning provided. It's situated on a really quiet street and our windows faced yard, so it was comfortable for sleeping. Very close to city center - 5 min walk to Leidsplein, then 5 min by tram/15 min by walk to Dam Square. Lovely Vondelpark just opposite the hotel. Breakfast was very good and costed 15 euros. Room we expected to be a bit bigger and there were no shelves either in the wardrobe, no in the bathroom. But neverheless everything was clean and nice. Reception service was great. We were provided with all tourist information we asked for. All in all we enjoyed our stay, though the hotel is a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Paint and polish required”
Reviews.Author: counterpoint321
Reviews.Content: The brochure for this hotel is extremely flattering to what is now a somewhat bruised and peeling establishment, although a few cans of paint would work wonders. Our smallish room (standard for Amsterdam) had chipped woodwork, peeling paint and cracked plaster, which wasn't helped by the fact that there was no fridge in the room and only the smallest of wardrobes. The reception staff, however, were very helpful and friendly and the cozy bar area was a welcome respite from the crowded shopping streets nearby. Perfect location if you want to shop in Amsterdam's smartest boutiques or visit its wonderful museums, and the fact that this hotel is located on a quiet residential street facing the beautiful Vondelpark ensures a lot more peace and quiet than many other hotels can offer.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: LondonMadmax
Reviews.Content: Good value, well located, comfortable, rooms are clean and though not spacious are sensibly appointed. Small issues were dealt with in a friendly and helpful way.

Reviews.Title: “Well located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ferry41
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location on a quiet street near the Vondelpark away from the noise of the centre of the city. It is nonetheless close to museums and the Leidseplein. I stayed in a single room which was quite small, but very nicely designed in a modern style (touch sensitive bed lamp etc.). Furnishings were slightly tired (shower attachment was broken etc). The lobby area was nice and staff were reasonably helpful. In general recommended. If it had a better attention for detail, it would achieve top marks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and modern decor. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: simba4007
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. For a nice city hotel, it was very reasonably priced (if not cheap!) compared to everything else we saw in Amsterdam. The location is fantastic as its 5mins walk from Leidseplein and Museum district and right outside the Vondelpark but it is still on a quite road so no noise. Staff were very friendly and helpful and recommended some great places to eat - local places (not full of tourists!). The decor is modern and the rooms were very clean. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but far from a boutique”
Reviews.Author: EP99
Reviews.Content: Hotel Piet Hein isn't horrible. The lobby is pretty nice and modern. Rooms are sufficient and somewhat modern, though fairly small even for Europe. Also, it is in a pretty good location, fairly central and literally right next to the park in case you are interested in jogging, etc. It markets itself as a "boutique." I'm not sure everybody has the same definition of boutique, but it failed to meet my expectations. If your definition of boutique includes the following, you'll feel right at home: (1) cold treatment by front desk, who seemed more interested in talking to each other than helping guests; (2) maid service left dirty dishes in room, suggesting poor cleaning in general; (3) wireless was spotty and constantly kicked you off; (4) bath towels smallest of long trip in Europe; and (5) not enough space to store luggage for partial day after check out, something I've never encountered in many years of hotel travel. Again, the hotel isn't horrible, and I got the impression that other rooms may be nicer. However, the hotel cannot get more than 3/5.

Reviews.Title: “nice experience at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: audmonamikaela
Reviews.Content: we were lucky to be transferred here because it is really nice..big room..overlooking vondel park..tv is ok..bathroom is ok..the staff is very accommodating..esp. evening where i ordered toast for me and my baby..the place is near luxury stores...near hard rock cafe...nice surroundings...i look forward to stay there again...downside..stairs...not good if you travel with stroller for small kids... i guess most hotels in amsterdam have stairs leading to the receiving room..i almost forget..the breakfast..very sumptous...love their servings..and warm chocolate...

Reviews.Title: “great location on vondelpark”
Reviews.Author: ixou
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in a single room which was a bit small, as well as the bathroom. The staff were very helpful and breakfast is really great in a nice airy room leading onto a courtyard. One of very few hotels allowing you to have breakfast until 11.00 am!!! The lobby and bar are quite trendy. The location couldn't be better, right on Vondelpark, next to museums and tram. I was on 4th floor with view on park which was lovely, mostly at night.

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel in the best location of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: curious_traveller26
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed three nights at the Piet Hein in to celebrate New Years 2010. We are two women in our twenties. It was a very clean hotel with a nice modern decor. I was very satisfied with the service; staff was always helpful and available with restaurant recommendations and tips for the city. The location was safe and optimal to walk anywhere. The price was also very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “mouses in room”
Reviews.Author: mouse72
Reviews.Content: nice location but there are mouses in the room. if you like mouses i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: clarry2
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms were small but modern. We stayed in a twin and the beds were pushed together. Staff were brilliant and very helpful. Breakfast was good and was looking out over a lovely courtyard...but be aware some sites say its included and when you pay the invoice prints out that it is excluded. Had a small issue with cleanliness on the first room but they changed us immediately and apoligetically. The next room was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy and comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: jasmine05
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights & really enjoyed it. Hotel has very nice designer decor & room had a very comfy bed, everything was very clean, really nice large shower with sparkling fittings. Room didnt have tea/coffee/mugs/spoons etc, but a kettle could be borrowed. Also I ended up buying my own coffee & then just asking them for a spare cup and spoon. The staff at reception were very nice, my room's window had a broken latch which meant it didnt close properly. Upon telling reception, they were very kind and gave me the keys to another room to check whether I liked it first. It was a bonus as the room was at the top level,so views were nicer ( even though only looked out to their garden/outdoor seating area). I had a single room, admittedly it was small, but it was spotlesslessly clean(a little whiff of cigarettes I must admit, but that's expected in Amsterdam). They have a non smoking policy, but I guess it can be hard to monitor. Was very quiet & had double windows that opened out onto the garden. Also had free wi-fi with a fast connection & right near vondelpark. Only negatives is that it is quite expensive & didnt include breakfast..not sure if that was an option. Also note that it is near some backpacker hostels, but is still in a nice area of Amsterdam & central.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not special”
Reviews.Author: Panth
Reviews.Content: We'de read good things about Piet Hein and some were certainly true. It is well placed, particularly for museums, the hotel is clean and modern and the staff are friendly. However, it did let itself down in some areas. Lighting throughout the hotel was poor. Our room was quite dark, as was the bar; the latter would have been fine for a cosy drink but not if you wanted to use the internet (though this was at least free). The room had its own safe (again free) but this was on the floor inside a wardrobe, so very awkward to access, and again extremely badly lit. There was very little storage space in the room. There were no drawers of any kind, which meant that most clothes had to remain in suitcases. The bathroom was clean with plenty of hot water but some of the fixtures were strangely located and not entirely securely fixed. Having said all that, the staff were very helpful and the breakfast was good, with decent choice. I would not advise people to avoid the hotel, just don't believe everything you read!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishtravellor20
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at this hotel, and to be honest I was kind of glad. The hotel itself is gorgeous and the staff were lovely but the single room was really tiny. â‚¬105 for 1 night and I couldnâ€™t relax in it for a minute, I was glad to leave the room. I woke up during the night to find there was no air conditioning and when I went to open the window, I seen that my window was facing another window and as I was on the ground floor no fresh air at all was coming in. It was horrible trying to sleep. The bathroom in my room was lovely and the free internet in the lobby was great. The staff were very helpful and polite. I was very disappointed with the single room, however if I was to return I might give the double room a go, as i really liked the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly, clean and hassle-free stay”
Reviews.Author: VikrMada1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in March while checking out the Amsterdam museums. I arrived very early in the morning and the room I had booked wasnt yet available, but they upgraded me to a bigger room after a brief wait. Staff was very friendly and I didnt have any problems of any kind. The location is very convenient (close to the Van Gogh museum) and there's even a bakery around the corner. Overall it was a pretty good stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chispita59
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice, rooms tiny tiny. the only problem was that the man of cleaness came into the room and we were sleeping!!!

Reviews.Title: “Room smelled like bug insecticide”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFinn1980
Reviews.Content: The smell in the room was very bad. They might have a bug problem (or maybe they just solved it?) because the whole room smelled like bug insecticide, in other words, toxic used to kill bugs. This made my stay quite unpleasant. Otherwise the room was clean, although a bit on the small side. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pay Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: ghnad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Peit Hein when visiting Amsterdam on many occasions. Location is great, meters away from the fashion district and high end restaurants. Breakfast is pleasant. Staff friendly. Value for money. Rooms are small, too small but this is Amsterdam. Cleanliness is a great concern in Amsterdam. On my last trip I noticed grime in between the tiles in the shower and the overall appearance of the bathroom was dirty, worried, I was reluctant to use it. The dirt observed was obvious and not cleaned the following days. I started feeling unsure about the bed sheets too. I am worried this hotel is masking its overall appearance with the boutique look. I will not stay here again. But, having said that some 5 start hotels in Amsterdam are getting worse reviews. Amsterdam is not a place for clean cut visitors. It is a very dirty place when you pay attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Guilty of false advertising”
Reviews.Author: Lina
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked an executive double room at the Piet Hein for November 2009. Their web-site pictures showed an elegant and spacious modern room done in greys, tans and black. Good lighting, nice linens and updated bathroom!! I actually called the hotel to secure the reservation, making sure an executive double was available. It was to be the last stop on our 3 week trip to Europe and we planned to spend 6 nights there. We wanted to end on a high note. This would be our most expensive hotel at just under 200 Euros a night. Our taxi driver could not find the hotel but this is not an uncommon phenomenon. The hotel is situated on Vondelpark. The public entry is very stylish with a nice seating area, chic and busy small bar and a few computers near the front desk for the clients' use. The lobby has a young, business traveller feel. We were shown to a room on the top floor. All white. It was just large enough to hold the queen size bed and allow the room door to open. An attic room, the ceiling was slanted and a small beam ran down it so that in bed one would hit one's head if turning towards one's partner!! There was a small window looking out at the park. The bathroom was of almost equal size but had been modernized (but several things were in disrepair). I realized this was not the room I had seen on the website and thought an error in booking had occurred. Not so. This WAS the executive double. I urged the young man behind the desk to visit the website with me. I showed him the room that was pictured/offered and that I thought I had booked. "I want that room!", I said. It doesn't exist. The photo is a mock up that is intended to give a "feeling" of the style of the hotel!!!! I was furious. This was a clear case of misrepresentation. Much drama followed. We booked somewhere else and I threatened to slam the hotel on the internet. Finally 2 new behind-the-deskers worked with me to find a quiet, much less expensive "older" room. We ended up enjoying our stay. The reduced rate helped a lot. Breakfasts, included, are very good with ample amounts and choices. The staff were helpful with giving directions and calling cabs. Not so true of their restaurant suggestions but I recognize that this is a highly subjective area. We loved the location. All in all I would not advise against staying at the Piet Hein I would just warn .. buyer, beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location Good Price”
Reviews.Author: eelco28
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of the old city, walking distance to all the great museums and night life. Nice, hotel with breakfast and a small bar for a late night drink.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel all around”
Reviews.Author: Jeffbuc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the PietHein for 2 nights and enjoyed the hote;. It is within walking distance to anything and next to a beautiful park (Vondelpark). The hotel is very moden with LCD tv, keyless entry (knd of) and an in room safe. The only annoyance was the shower curtain did not meet the floor and the whole bathroom floor got wet every shower. Friendly staff and free internet access in the lobby and with wifi adds a nice touch. I would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable and Irresponsible”
Reviews.Author: digitalican
Reviews.Content: This is not the worst hotel I've stayed in, but was close. The room was tiny and uncomfortable (and I do not need a big hotel room.) The staff was totally unconcerned about problems, including a nonworking wireless internet and nonworking facilities. I would absolutely not stay here again. I felt as if I were in a youth hostel.

Reviews.Title: “All average until checkout, HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: HappyNomadLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Our room in this hotel was small, but that's to be expected in most hotels in Europe, specially in mid priced hotels, but the room was clean. The location was pretty central to most transportation and within walking distance to museums. All in all, the hotel is decent, but I rated this hotel poor because of my horrible experience with my checkout at the hotel. My friend and I checked out early that morning and the person that checked us out was trying to charge us for the breakfast that according to my email communication with the hotel, it was included with the room rate. I tried to explain this to him and he was very flip about it as if I was just trying to get out of paying the bill. I told him that I believed I may have the email in my room that I just checked out of and I wanted to get it, he replied by saying, "why would you leave it there?", so I proceeded to go to the room, what I didn't know was, until my friend told me that remained in the lobby, that the person at the front desk, locked the front door to the hotel, as if I may escape without paying, which was pretty much impossible since I had some pretty big suitcases right at the front desk. Unfortunately I couldn't find my email, so I reluctantly paid my bill and decided to just try and get the refund through management at a later time. I communicated with the hotel via email when I got back to the US, even forwarding the email proof, but to no avail. They did apologize for the checkout person's behavior, but it doesn't really help the situation. I love to travel and do it often, my experiences are usually good, this has never happened to me and it hasn't happened to me since. I love recommending hotels but not this one, good service is important and part of that is trying to make things right when there was an obvious grievance that was done to a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SweTee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Piet Hein for one night in August 2009 with friends. Our room was very clean and a good size and there is an elevator in the hotel which is a bonus as the stairs in Amsterdam can be very steep and a nightmare to carry your luggage up. The only small downside is that the hotelrooms don't have a minibar or facilities to make coffee or tea. The location is great, very near the entrance to Vondelpark and close to Leidseplein with tram lines.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice close to Museumplein and a very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: marcioas
Reviews.Content: Before going there, and during my stay, I have read and heard a few comments about the size of the rooms. Some people complaining about it. But mine (144, 4th floor), wasn't that small and was very silent. It was clean and confortable. For me the best thing was the breakfast. The hotel is besides Vondelpark and is close to a nice intertainment area. Easy access to Van Gogh Museum. But one small mistake almost spoiled it. I asked the reception for a wake up call, as I had a train to catch very early. Fortunately, I have set up television alarm too. I woke up, thanks to this alarm and took a shower, waiting to see if my ring was going to ring. After that I called reception, as I wanted them to call a taxi for me. Nobody answered. Thirty seconds later the phone rings (13 minutes late), and the guy says "wake up call!". What a joke! I woke up the one who was supposed to wake me up!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Abonda
Reviews.Content: Although on first glance this ought to be a good hotel in a great location (park across the street, a few blocks from the 2 great museums), I must admit disappointment in our experience. First, the desk staff seemed distant and perfunctory, then the bar keeper was rude. The bar was usually filled with what seemed to be friends of the hotel staff as both the evening desk staff and the bar keeper were always occupied with them, laughing and carrying on throughout the evening. The constant loud noise filtered into our room requiring us to request that the noise be suppressed. Thankfully, there were 2 sets of double doors between the lobby/bar and the rooms that the staff then closed, which solved the noise problem. The following night I closed both sets of doors myself when we retired to our room. However, the bar keeper opened a door while I was in the lobby checking email on one of the 4 computers available to guests for free (a plus!). I immediately went to him and asked that he close the door and said that the noise from the bar bothered us in our room. His attitude was confrontative - "Well aren't you out here?" "It is hot in here." No apology, no concern for the hotel guests, he went back to party with his friends at the bar. This interaction certainly spoiled what should have been a nicer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value great location hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: pestofthewest
Reviews.Content: Tiny single rooms but the location, service and lobby area more than make up for it. The price represented extraordinary value too, I can't fault the place; if your looking for an inexpensive, reasonably stylish and not too boutiquie hotel experience in the perfect part of Amsterdam, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: BimBamB
Reviews.Content: Firstly, in Amsterdam terms, this hotel is good value for money. There are many other hotels in the city charging the same or more that are of a far lower all-round standard. The hotel is pleasantly located in the museum district of the city next to the Vondelpark. You are very close to the Van Gogh museum and the Rijksmuseum. This is a quiet-ish area at the opposite end of the city to the red light district and the associated hordes of young lads on the hunt for beer and more besides. This, in my view at least, is a big positive. It does mean a bit of a tram trip from Centraal Station, but this only takes 10 mins or so, which isn't too bad. You can walk to the centre of the city in 10-15 mins and there are many restaurants and bars close by. The decor of the hotel is fairly modern and stylish. Our room was bright and clean, with large windows looking out onto the park in front of the hotel - a nice view. We got a great view of sunset each day, which was a bonus. We did not get disturbed by any noise at night, unlike some other reviewers. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, so cannot comment except to say that it seemed fairly expensive, but that's a subjective matter. The staff were always friendly and helpful and provided maps and advice upon request. There was free internet access in the lobby, but you had to pay (a substantial amount) to get wi-fi in the rooms, which seems a little behind the times. Overall, we had a very nice stay here, and would recommend the Piet Hein. You could certainly do a lot worse in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Warm friendly atmosphere - great stay”
Reviews.Author: TigerTimUK
Reviews.Content: After having to drive rather than fly due to the snow we received a warm welcome. We were attending conference at Hilton which was only 15 minutes away but â‚¬200 per night more expensive !! No problems with noise or heat in room (137). Very confusing room numbers but soon got used to it. Pay TV system is dead despite being advertised in room. Free internet PCs in lobby were fast Didn't have breakfast or use Wifi so can't comment Will be back next year !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but it was very loud”
Reviews.Author: roobieroo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very upscale feel and the bar area and my room were quite nice. My biggest issue with my stay was that my room was located at the foot of some stairs just outside of the main lobby. As a result it was hard to get to sleep and I ended up being woken up early in the morning. You'll hear people walking up and down the steps and dealing with the front desk staff. If it's possible I would try and ask where your room is and if it's near the stairs or on the lowest floor then I'd recommend you book at another hotel. If you can get a room in a better location then I'm sure you'll have a better stay. The location is a bit of a walk from the train station and from the main museums but if you're in good shape it shouldn't be an issue. If you have problems walking then you'll want to look elsewhere. It's in a nice neighborhood next to a large park and I felt very safe there. If you can verify where your room will be then I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good...the Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: Broadway_Gal
Reviews.Content: Overall, a very good hotel for the price. Pros: + Very convenient location - so many things within walking distance! + As a single woman, I felt it was a fairly safe location. + Clean rooms + Friendly, helpful and very efficient staff + Very good breakfast, lovely breakfast room + Computers with fast and free internet access in the lobby for guests Cons: - Very dim lighting in rooms and lobby - My bed was extremely soft. Back-ache! - View of the room was directly into windows accross..no privacy. - Hard to use the safe they have provided. But there is one! Helpful to know if you've decided to stay there: * Key card for door works like bar code - you scan it * As you enter your room, you must slide your key card into a slot inside near the door - it allows you to turn the lights on and off. * Hot/cold on the shower faucet was not obvious! Take a really good look at the snowflakes carved into the handle. One is larger than the other...that's your clue.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: FifiNotts
Reviews.Content: I used Trip Advisor in May when going to Barcelona and consequently loved the Hotel Monte Carlo on Las Ramblas. I was therefore confident that the Hotel Piet Hein would provide the same experience. I booked what was described as a 'deluxe' room but was disappointed on arrival to be shown to a very small basic room that had not been refurbished for four years and was therefore nothing like the stylish images of the hotel shown on the website. I looked out of the very small window onto the side of a building and could see into an adjacent window. My son was very disappointed and I asked the receptionist if we indeed had a 'deluxe' room. She said 'What is deluxe?' Well, I appreciate 'deluxe' could be a matter of interpretation but that room did not even come near. We were, however, shown to a different room which was more in line with our expectations. Apart from this, our stay was very enjoyable. The hotel indeed has a lovely bar area and a very helpful barman. The restaurant was lovely, the breakfast good and the service in the restaurant was superb. In particular, Diana made our stay memorable. The location was great, we loved the area and felt very safe. I would recommend this hotel; just make sure you are clear about the type of room you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and stylish.”
Reviews.Author: nickisee
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Very clean and the staff was very nice. The lobby is very modern and stylish. They have 4 free computers to use in the lobby which is great to quickly check the weather or email from home. The breakfast is really yummy-they bake fresh croissants that are to die for. The room is small-but it was fine for our needs. The bed was comfy and tub was deep. The room was super quiet and we never were disturbed by noise. The hotel runs along the side of Vondelpark, so the street is also pretty quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Attention!”
Reviews.Author: natakola
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, ideal location! BUT don't leave any money in the room or any other valuable things. My parents were robbed, hotel managemnet caught the thief. BUT money was not returned as it was promised by hotel manager. That's a pity, be cautious

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: oceangirl2008
Reviews.Content: After much research, we decided to stay at this hotel. We loved it. It is small, but clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quiet. Walking distance to everything - the Van Gogh Museum, the Rijksmuseum (closed, but one part is open), Vondel Park, we even walked to the Anne Frank house, which everyone said was very far, but it was an easy walk. The room was clean, the bathroom clean, everything worked very well. A couple of blocks away is an amazing shopping street - Chanel, Louis Vuitton, and every designer you can think of. The hotel has free internet, a small lobby and bar, but the ambiance is relaxing and the surroundings are beautiful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Piet Hein”
Reviews.Author: Boogie77
Reviews.Content: The Piet Hein is a great boutique hotel. It's within walking distance of the Van Gogh museum, the House of Bols, and other great museums, lounges and bars. It was also very close to bike rental shops. I was a bit disappointed by the size of my room and the single bed (apparently when you travel solo in Euope that's what you get) until I noticed the fabulous balcony it had with a great view of the park. The room was clean but bare bones. Divas seek shelter elsewhere. The bathroom was brand new and always clean. The hotel has a great little bar and a friendly bartender who serves up great cocktails and gives great advice about how to get around the city. I made it a point to have at least one drink at the bar every day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arbet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights here in July. We highly recommend this hotel to others who are looking for a moderate-priced hotel in Amsterdam. It is a short walk to the Van Gogh, the Rijksmuseum, Leidseplein, and the #5 tram. The rooms are clean and comfortable, a good breakfast buffet is included, Internet is free, and the ladies at the front desk are helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: confunkey
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Piet Hein in February 2008 for a long weekend. We loved the Piet Hein - the room was gorgeous. It was big, the bed was huge and very comfortable, we had a great flat screen TV. The bathroom was great, and everything was spotlessly clean. The breakfast was lovely, plenty of variety, great quality. The reception staff were very nice - they provided us with a map when we checked in, and marked the hotel location on it as well as some directions for us to get to various locations we might want to see. We later asked for restaurant recommendations, and we ended up in a fantastic place - I'm afraid I can't remember what it was called, but it was an excellent choice. They also helped us with the metro. The barman was also great, very friendly and chatty. There was free internet access in the lobby area. On our last night, we were a little worse for wear (too much dutch beer!) and I had a terrible hangover the next morning. I called down to the reception and they let us check out a couple of hours late at no extra cost - which was very helpful. All in all, I loved the hotel, the staff were brilliant and I would absolutely stay there again if I went back to Amsterdam. As with most places, they really do love it if you make the effor to speak a bit of their language, even though everyone speaks English extremely well. Ask how to say please and thank you in Dutch - they were very patient with me when I kept repeating it back to check I had it right, and kept getting it wrong anyway. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location; helpful staff but very basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: DitN
Reviews.Content: Piet Hein Hotel is located next to several museums in Amsterdam (including Van Gogh and Rijkmuseum); and an easy tram ride from the central Dam Square (or a 30-minute walk). The location and staff are very good. The hotel has free wireless Internet (although it was slow or broken at times). The rooms are very small, and basic, but clean. Normally, you don't need air conditioning in Amsterdam, but open window can be noisy. It's a good value, however, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little gem, with some minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: millersdad
Reviews.Content: I took my (senior) mother for her first trip to Europe. I had booked us for a Tulip Time River Cruise for 9 days on Avalon Waterways. (that will not be reviewed here, other than let me say Hendrick, the cruise director we had made our experience first class.) We actually had two stays here. One for a couple days prior to our river cruise which we booked through Hotels.com and post-cruise I had booked directly with the hotel. I had many communications with the hotel staff prior to our arrival, since I wanted to make sure of many things prior to our departure from the U.S. They were always very prompt and courteous in responding to all my questions. Most times they responded within a couple hours, but certainly always within a day. (Don't forget the time zone changes from when I was writing them and actual work hours for the main staff.) On both of our stays we were roomed in the front of the hotel (the "old part") which faced Vondelpark. It does face a side street and I was concerned with street noise but that was absolutely not an issue. (Also remember we were there in April, so the windows did not have to be open due to warm weather. If you are visiting during more "summery months" and you're disturbed by noises, you may want to consider upgrading to a room with air conditioning.) We arrived quite early into Schiphol and caught a Connexxions hotel shuttle that dropped us off directly at the hotel. It was a great alternative for someone that doesn't want to pay taxi fees and you don't have to mess with the wonderful mass transit buses with a bunch of luggage. The shuttle dropped us off at Piet Hein well before the posted check-in time. I cannot say enough positive concerning the front desk staff! They were very kind to us and when they saw the haggard appearance of myself and my mother from the flight, rushed to have our room readied hours before the posted check-in time. They held our luggage in a secure room while we went out to have breakfast. Upon our return from getting food into our bellies the room was prepared and they offered to assist us with our baggage, however they were very busy at the time with other guests so I got mom into the room and then I made a second trip to the luggage room for our remaining bags. The room was on the smallish side, compared to U.S. hotels, however it was decently laid out and had all the amenities we needed. The room was quaint, with a nautical feel, befitting a country that is "of the sea". The bathroom was very modern with a double flush toilet (little flush/big flush) to conserve water. As found in most European hotels, they provide an "all purpose" liquid soap that is used for hand washing and bathing/washing hair (it is wonderful and unless you have special skin concerns, works superbly.) Note however, I had asked them if they provided wash cloths for bathing and they assured me they did. (My mother asked me to check on this, as when her mother went to England years before mentioned they are not supplied.) Through translation they didn't understand what I was asking and there were not wash cloths. There were hand towels, regular bath towels and a bath mat, but not a hand cloth to be found. **PLEASE NOTE** If you book through any hotel booking service other than directly through them the morning breakfast is NOT included in the cost of your hotel stay. Since the first stay was booked through Hotels.com breakfast would have been extra. We opted to catch something to eat at one of the many places in the vicinity. On our stay after our river cruise, which we had booked directly with the hotel, breakfast was included and we found it more than sufficient with the variety of items and the quality of the food provided. We loved the location of the hotel. Close to many of the museums we were interested in, overlooking Vondelpark and away from the hustle and bustle that we experienced when nearer to Centraal Station. Upon our return from the river cruise we had the room directly over our previous room. This had even more space in the room due to where a single closet was placed. It made a huge difference, even though the closet in the first room only took up approximately 6 sq feet near the beds. In the second room that closet was positioned near the entrance door and made a world of difference. When we were on the river cruise the boat did have wash cloths, (confession time) and one of them came up missing in our stateroom, which later served us well when we returned to the hotel. The section of the hotel we stayed in had an elevator making access to the rooms easy. I took the stairs many times and enjoyed the small amount of exercise going up and down. However the steps tend to be quite steep and my mother would have had difficulty in walking the stairs. So, again, fellow traveler, if this might be an issue for anyone in your party, check with the staff ahead of time to make sure this will not be an issue. In a review I had read, the traveler mentioned their room had a step or two from the floor of the sleeping area and the bathroom. I consulted with them prior to our departure to Amsterdam that our room would not have the steps, as my mother sometimes gets up in the middle of the night and I didn't want harm coming to her. In closing, is this the PERFECT hotel? No, one can always nitpick any accommodation apart. However, if one is looking for a reasonably price hotel, convenient to many of the museums and Vondelpark, a great desk staff that is more than willing to help you plan your day touring Amsterdam, and beds that are very comfortable, you could do MUCH worse than staying at the quaint Hotel Piet Hein.

Reviews.Title: “awesome and affordable”
Reviews.Author: interbum
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 1 night in a double room. very pleasant atmosphere and helping staff. room was pretty big, but cousy and well decorated (if anyone finds it important). bathroom was clean and shiny. the place is well maintained, clean and smells good :) breakfast was the best I ever had in mid range hotels. the only downside is the 10 minute walk to tram. though in walking distance from major museums, and the near Vondelpark is a nice walk. an overall great hotel for the price (paid 100e inc brkfst), if this is your price range definitely take it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: babash
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a last minute deal for Queens Day. Good location, close enough to action yet reasonably quiet and my single room was very adequate with good design and nice bathroom. At 90euros per night it was the upper end of my budjet however I cant complain given I got it on2weeks notice when everywhere else was fully booked. Receptionist was a bit chilly and some of the internet computers did not work but all in all a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jane036
Reviews.Content: Impressed by Tripadvisor reviews I decided for this hotel and made reservation for twin superior room. The room we got was not twin, but we were adviced by recepitionist to put beds apart by ourselves. Well, it was no spare place to move beds as the room was very very small attic room. Window was very small as well. Acctually there was wall of another building in front of window and smoke from chimney was comming into the room if window was open. Furniture was poor and we had impression of very cheap hotel, but the price was not so low as the quality. One of probles was also noise, if somebody went to the bathroom in neighbouring room it was like he would been in our room. We were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: JDBLondon
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is a 10 min tram trip to the old centre, its in a really nice location just by the park and behind a very posh shopping street. We didnt mind having to jump on the tram but you will need to use a cab if your staying out late as the trams stop and I dont think you could walk it back easily. I think we were given one of the worse rooms as we did get a good deal on the hotel. It was very small and basic but the bed was comfy and if your not planning to stay in your room other than to sleep its all you really need. The downstairs of the hotel is really nice and Im sure from what others have said that there are some good rooms. Overall, good location and good value for money compared to other places we looked at. However its pretty basic and if you want to be in the centre of it all its probably not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: jahjah01
Reviews.Content: If you're in Amsterdam for a couple of days and want a GREAT location and don't mind a small room, this is the place. It is two blocks from the Rjiksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. I walked all over the city from the hotel. The staff are very helpful, particularly Martina. The breakfast is so so. Also the hotel is located near the PC shops. If you go there, go to the PC Cafe. I'm still thinking about the sandwich I had. The rooms are SMALL!! But the bed was comfortable and it kept me out of my room since I was there to see the city anyway not lay in the lap of luxury. The free internet is also a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “My third trip to Hotel Piet Hein”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my 7th visit to Amsterdam and my 3rd stay at Hotel Piet Hein. It has undergone a radical renovation and expansion since my last stay two years ago but the professionalism of staff, the cleanliness and the general welcoming ambience of the hotel has remained the same. I am already looking forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “More than a 3 star in many ways”
Reviews.Author: Massimo1
Reviews.Content: The Piet Hein is a hotel I would certainly like to stay at again. It is a very modern-style boutique hotel, very well presented, and reasonably priced. They bill themselves as a 3 star. In a sense they are because it is relatively basic in facilities (such as no minibars), yet the overall impression is of a higher caliber. Call it a 3.5 star. My first night, I was on the top floor back, which is very quiet, overlooking a commons and the back of other buildings on the block. Personally, I rather like that sort of view. The room was a bit small, but had a nice bathroom and a nice double bed. Unfortunately, there was a problem with the heating system, so I was upgraded to a wonderful front room for my second night. It was larger, with bay windows overlooking Vondelpark. On the downside, the front rooms do get some street noise (cars, trams, buses), but it dies down after midnight. The beds were comfy, not quite as firm as I like, but fine. The rooms are modern, with some nice non-hotel feeling furniture, so in spite of being modern, there is some character to the rooms. There seems to be a nautical theme running through the place. The lobby is attractive, has a bar, a sitting area, and free internet access. If you are a business traveler without heavy demands, you will like this place. In fact, a lot of business travelers seem to stay there. I didn't try the breakfast, but it appeared to be a standard simple cold breakfast selection of bread, cereal, fruit cocktail, cheese, meats, hard boiled eggs, etc. Freshly toasted cheese and meat sandwiches were offered, though. I can't say enough good things about the staff. Anything I needed or wanted to know, they were on it. My only negative comments have to do with the bathrooms. The toilet paper dispenser, in my room anyway, was a bit of a reach, and the control fixtures in the shower were counter-intuitive. Being "modern", it took me a few minutes to get the hang of them. One knob is for water flow, the other is for temperature mix. But now I'm prepared for the next time I stay there :-). The Piet Hein is in a great location, 10 minutes or less walk from Leidseplein, the Van Gogh Museum, the Rijksmuseum, and high-street shopping. So you are close to everything, or can take a tram or taxi if you need to go farther, like the Central Station. I also want to recommend a really great Thai restaurant not too far away at Leidseplein. Its the Royal Thai at Lange Leidsewarsstraat 94.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel a find”
Reviews.Author: NZguy1
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. extremely good value for money. i would stay there again. it is clean with a professional staff and a pleasant lobby/bar. good LOCATION as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: avalon626
Reviews.Content: This cute little hotel is in a quiet location. Unfortunately, the renovations are not yet complete and the noise from construction was a bit disruptive. Fortunately, we had no issues with smoke odors in our room (3rd floor). The beds are very comfy. The rooms are not large, but tastefully decorated. The location is great for people who want to visit the museums. There are many shops within walking distance and (if you're in average shape) you can basically walk anywhere in the city within a half hour. Bring a good map because it's easy to get lost. The staff were pleasant and spoke English well. The cold breakfast buffet is perfectly edible. I would stay here again, provided the construction is over & done with.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist base, not for asthmatics”
Reviews.Author: wandering8
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located beside the Vondelpark in Amsterdam - we stayed in two rooms with three guests for four nights. The location of this hotel is its prime selling factor, it is minutes away from the Van Gogh museum, a five minute walk to the trolleys and canal boats. It is a quiet street away from the bustling of the city centre, so not in the heart of the nightlife but still in good walking distance to many attractions. The rooms were simply decorated in a nautical theme, small as one would expect in Amsterdam, but fine. The toilets were clean and fresh towels provided daily. My main complaint with this hotel was the smell of smoke was everywhere, there was no such thing as non-smoking rooms, the rooms were not airtight and it was a bit oppressive. The lobby stank of smoke as the bar opened right onto the main sitting area, and this smell floated up the hall to the upper floors. I know that not all hotels in Amsterdam provide for the non-smoker but this place was a bit much and sadly would prevent us going back - although it is very nicely located and for the price the rooms are nice. If you don't spend much time in the hotel, as we didn't, it might be ok, or if you are a smoker you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “LaiYee”
Reviews.Author: LLYSLC
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Piet Hein during 3 nights and it was a pleasant stay. The room was small, but for an Amsterdam room it was big!!!! My room had a view of the garden, and Air conditioned. This hotel doesnÂ´t have the "Amsterdam typical stairs". The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was very nice. The location was great, walking distance from the Museumplein and the heart of Amsterdam. If you donÂ´t like to walk, trams are near (exit from the hotel, turn to the left, turn to the left again, walk for 1-2 min. and youÂ´ll find the tram stop on the 2nd road on the left . The trams are very fast, in a few minutes youÂ´ll be in the center (tram 2 or 5 go to the central station). The hotel doesnÂ´t have restaurant or minibar in the room but you can go to the supermarket (Albert Heijn) in the Museumplein. Take a boatcruise in The Blue Boat Cruises (near Leidsplein), it takes 75 min., itÂ´s nice to see Amsterdam from the canals. Next time I'm in Amsterdam I will be staying here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: JM_Bushwick
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Piet Hein. The staff was very nice and the location was great, just a few blocks from the Van Gogh Museum and the heart of Amsterdam. Yes, the rooms are small but very nicely done. I had a very nice room over looking the garden, and had a room with A/C (which I really didn't need because it was cold while I was there). While they were doing renovations during my stay, it did not cause any inconvenience to me. Truly a very nice place to stay. Also, I thought very reasonably price.

Reviews.Title: “Average Accomodation but very bad service”
Reviews.Author: Chabeli_ch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Piet Hein this spring and I can confirm that the service was bad. We decided that we would be taking de luxe rooms, because the standard rooms were too small. The room was OK, and quiet ( a luxus these days, it seems !). Our room was on the -1 floor, and we had very nice view on a little inside garden.The Dutch Breakfast was OK, but the staff lacked friendliness. The reason why we WILL NOT RETURN TO PIET HEIN ( and therefore DO NOT RECOMMAND IT) is the following : A young receptionnist booked us a tour to the famous Dutch Mills and told us to show up the next day at 13.15 in front of the hotel. So we did and discovered that he had booked us instead on the morning tour and that we couldn't go in the afternoon. The receptionnist that attended us that day - a young lady- told us that she was sorry.- She arranged for us to go in the afternoon anyway and since we were running out of time, she offered to pay us the taxi ... but she said, the taxi fee will be deducted from the receptionist salary.- Since I worked in the hotel business and knew how little people make, we said it would be OK to take the tram ( it was only 10-15 mn away). She thanked us and say that she WOULD MAKE IT UP TO US.... When we returned that day, the young receptionist was there again, he purposely turned his back on us, pretended to be busy, and NEVER TALKED TO US AGAIN. When we checked out, I told the story and asked what THEY COULD DO TO MAKE IT UP TO US...We asked several times, AND THEY SAID THAT THEY DID NOT KNOW WHAT WE WERE TALKING ABOUT... A little effort on their part would have greatly been appreciated... but nobody seemed to care ... So, PIET HEIN ? Thanks, but NO THANKS!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Book On-line from the US”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug8000
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good location and breakfast. Prices were signifcantly lower if you walk in vs booking on-line which I thought was unfair. Small rooms for price.

Reviews.Title: “Timing & Location”
Reviews.Author: marmie7
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Amsterdam in the last 5 years and was definitely our worst accomodation. The hotel had some wonderful assets like new bathrooms, nice Dutch breakfast and an attempt at chic, but the negatives far outweighed the positives. We were treated with total indifference and a slight abruptness at check-in. We were used to a very pleasant welcome on previous visits at other hotels in Amsterdam. For the price we were paying 150+ Euros/night per room we were disappointed to be in a room that had workmen building a scaffolding inches from our room's only window on the 2nd floor below ground level (-2). From 7:15- 5:30 the workers were singing, banging, clanging, and shouting. Also the sidewalk and road were blocked daily by the construction work. Apparently the PH is annexing the neighboring building. We had 2 rooms on the same floor and in the second room you could not hear the construction clatter. The room we had was either 200 or 210 ans was one to avoid! We will NOT stay there again. There are too many better values and locations to be found next time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaximillianAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: The Piet Hein hotel located on the Vossiusstraat nearby the PC Hooftstraat and the Van Gogh museum is in my opinion one of the best hotels in Amsterdam. For me this hotel was for a few years a little secret, I kept it for myself! Right now the hotel has become more known and it's many times occupied. The check-in is very pleasant, great staff and friendly service. The rooms vary in space and comfort but are all ok and very clean. The rooms are equipt with a very nice bed and a small workingdesk, the bathroom is small but has a good shower in the bath. Biggest plus is the reasonable pricing, especially when you stay for just 1 night the Piet Hein offers room for like 100 euros. Overall; one of the best places to stay, near musea and Leidseplein, good pricing and comfortable rooms. Keep in mind: except for breakfast; no food available.

Reviews.Title: “It will now be my hotel whenever I stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LongDaysJourneyInto
Reviews.Content: I placed my booking via the hotel website itself, as my friend, who lives in Amsterdam now, suggested it as it was very close to where she and her fiance (now husband) lived. She didn't know too much about it, only that it was nice and quaint and right next to the park and close to Van Gogh Museum, as I was going there for her wedding and to give her a hand in the preparation, I was absolutely ready to put up with whatever as long as it wasn't too expensive, and that it was clean and not too far from everything else. Initial impression over the internet was wonderful, they were friendly and efficient, and got in touch with me very quickly, and took note of any request that I placed and repeated them all back to me in their e-mail of confirmation. I then didn't think about it and got on with life until it was time for me to leave for the airport. It was just as lovely as my friend said and more so, as she had never been in there. I love a fry up breakfast every now and then, though the hotel did not provide that, they provided plenty others, fresh produce, fruits, cereals, breads, eggs, cold cuts, the whole place from top to bottom was spotless, and I never saw a sour face among the staffs, including the chambermaid, who wouldn't take the tips that I left out on the table until I saw her and gave it to her personally. The bar area was small but cosy and big enough for entertainment, on nights when I didn't fancy going out due to the torrential rain, I hung out at the bar with fellow travellers, the bar man was always in good spirit and endlessly amusing and fun. It was all in all such a wonderful experience that I'll recommend it to anyone who'd listen, and I hope to see some of you there and be as charmed by it as I am.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLovestotravel
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a European cruise. Prior to the cruise I stayed three nights at Hotel Piet Hein. My overall experience was excellent. The hotel is charming. Our room was spotlessly clean. It did not have a lot of storage space, but it was enough for a short stay. The bathroom was large and the room had a safe and hair dryer. The hotel is conveniently located to many attractions such as the museums, canal boat tours, Anne Frank's House and shopping which were all within walking distance. The staff was friendly and helpful. The airline lost my luggage . Linda, at the front desk, was extremely helpful in calling often to try to locate my luggage, which was fortunately found prior to my cruise. There is a breakfast room with an ample breakfast. This hotel provided excellent value and service. I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “If I had a hammer...”
Reviews.Author: edinburghedge
Reviews.Content: I had an enjoyable three night stay at the Hotel Piet Hein from June 11 - 14. I took the train from Schiphol to Central Station and the #5 tram from the station to the hotel. Public transportation in Amsterdam is excellent... user friendly and inexpensive. I arrived at the hotel to be greeted by the sight of scaffolding and the sound of power tools. The hotel is currently in the midst of extensive refurbishment, half of the ground floor is closed and under construction. The reception staff, situated at a table next to the bar, were efficient and professional. I was initially fearful when I was directed to my room in the basement, two floors down. I was traveling alone and expected my single room, (#204), to be small... and it was. The room was an ugly, dark shade of brown but was made much brighter by the very large window/door that opened onto the garden. Wow, what a surpise. I was thrilled to have outdoor space. The garden was lovely and well maintained. I was never bothered by construction noise in my room, (although it was audible during the day), simply closing my window/door blocked it out. I chatted with a couple of guests who were not as lucky. The room was clean and well presented. The twin bed was comfortable. I stocked up on bottled water and a few snacks from the Albert Heijn supermarket just a few blocks away so a refrigerator/mini bar would have been useful but there was none. The room did have a working safe and decent television reception. There is no restaurant in the hotel but breakfast is served and was included in my room rate. I'm embarrassed to admit that I was never up in time to take advantage of that. The lone piece of art on the walls was a sailing print, not bad for hotel decoration. The bathroom was a mixed bag. On the upside: it was clean and modern looking, and there was space to move about. On the downside: the soap and shampoo were one and the same and dispensed from a wall mounted fixture in the shower. Considering that traveling with liquids through airport security is such a hassle these days... it would have been better if there had been basic amenities. The hotel provided a shower cap and a shoe shine clothe. I'd rather had a decent bar of soap and a little bottle of shampoo. It didn't matter, I had the assortment I took from the Stockholm Sheraton. The towels were disappointingly thin and small. I booked this room on Expedia for Â£64 per night. I'm satisfied that I got value for money. The hotel has an excellent location: the tram stop is close, it's only a very short walk to Leidsplein, Vondel Park is right across the street, the major museums are within easy walking distance, and there are plenty of good cafes and resturants nearby. I recommend this hotel, especially if you find a good internet rate, but the construction could be a potentially serious problem. The busy tourist summer months seem an odd time to remodel.

Reviews.Title: “**Please read- You will thank us...**”
Reviews.Author: styliany
Reviews.Content: ***** Please read this if you are travelling soon...******* we stayed at this hotel June 6th until the 10th. A few notes on this hotel. -it is good walking distance to the sights. -it has breakfast included, and rates are reasonable -the morning staff at counter (females) are very nice -breakfast is simple yet nice.also nice breakfast room. *** our downside experiences*** PLEASE READ** ***there is construction going on both in the lobby, and ESPECIALLY on the building next door. this started at 7:30 am, so expect to get up early!!, also if you are staying in one of the rooms on the side the scafolding goes up past your window, so unless you want someone climbing into your room, keep your window closed!!! ** no air conditioning, and I wouldn't advise to keep your windows open ** our "veranda" was nice, but there were left over booze bottles and cigarettes from previous people, and the tiles don't cover the whole porch and are a tripping hazard, it looked unfinished. ** the evening staff are young and useless. we asked for car rental info, they told us they closed at 6pm (both in the area and at the airport-or so we were told) and made no effort to help- I got on the internet and found an Avis ( two min walk away) open until 8pm and found out the airport had car rentals open until 11pm, shoud they not have known this???? **** we had our car parked RIGHT OUTSIDE the front doors of the hotel, and went in for 10 minutes to have the front desk check on an address for us, and OUR CAR GOT BROKEN INTO. A side window was broken and our camera and equipment which was in the trunk and out of view were gone. We spent the last day in a police station filling out reports and getting replacement cars. *** My advice -- remember, you get what you pay for. At this hotel they have 1 or 2 staff members on a good day taking care of requests, and most often you have to "push" to get help with something. I found they were not well informed and felt it was very much like a "self service" experience. My advise, if you can afford it spend the money on a better hotel, possibly with a doorman that can add extra piece of mind. ( by the way, after they broke into our car, I noticed that there was a hostel on the same street.... go figure.
