Also, if you are renting a car, get full insurance. our deductable for that little window wa $30 euro. it would have been 200+ without. and parking outside the hotel is 3.60 euro per hour... food for thought.... have a great trip everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: TomDevon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate her birthday last weekend.On arrival we were greated by a helpful man on reception who immediately wished my wife a happy birthday (we had mentioned this on booking). The room we were given was at the rear of the hotel and had a balcony.It was a large room with what appeared to be a newly fitted bathroom suite which had a very nice shower ! The hotel staff had also left a complimentary bottle of wine and card to wish my wife a happy birthday - what a nice touch and I doubt that many other hotels would have done that.There is also a nice relaxing bar area. We felt the breakfast (cereals, fresh fruit, cheese, ham, rolls, eggs,jam and cofee, tea & juices) was very good especially when the deal we had included the breakfast for less than the cost of many 'accommodation only' deals we had looked at.The breakfast room was nice and also appeared to have been recently refurbished.The hotel itself is situated in a nice location - a quiet street right alongside Vondelpark (though this is currently being relandscapped where the hotel is situated). To get to the hotel you need get tram 2 or 5 from centraal station and get off at the Van Gough museum or the stop just before (I cant remember the name of this one though). The Leidesplein is only a 5/10 minute walkaway where there are plenty of bars and restaurants.Pretty much everywhere in Amsterdam is walkable if you are reasonably fit and I feel sure that if you stay at this hotel you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and clean, only little rooms”
Reviews.Author: dottorsocrates
Reviews.Content: They always book me at this hotel while I attend the Hortifair in AMsterdam. The hotel is centrally located, not too close to the RAI.Breakfast is ok but self service. Rooms are quite small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just where we wanted to be!”
Reviews.Author: MyLSD
Reviews.Content: Having been to Amsterdam three times prior to this visit, I was very picky about where we were going to stay. We were looking for a place that was affordable, clean, and close to the main areas we wanted to be at. The Piet Hein was the perfect location! It is practically two minutes walking distance from the Holland Casino/Wagamama Restaurant area... thus, it took us a mere 5 minutes just to get to the main Leisaplein area. We practically walked everywhere from the hotel and we felt very safe walking back at night. The room was VERY neat and modern looking. The beds were comfortable for us and was not like your typical 'small european' hotel rooms. There is an elevator in the hotel - for bringing your luggage up. Its not your 5 star hotel, but it is a much more comfortable place to stay at than a hostel. The photos that are provided through the link on tripadvisor ARE pretty accurate of what the hotel and rooms will look like. What you see should be what you'll get. It's what we got. Everyone who worked at the hotel was very nice and helpful. When we needed to make a special birthday dinner reservation, the woman at the desk promptly took care of that for us and had a cab called when we were ready to leave. Our room happened to come with the complimentary breakfast. The breakfast was excellent, much better than other hotels we've stayed at (perhaps because other guests were paying 10 Euros). I wouldn't have paid for the breakfast (because there are SOOOO many other places to eat within walking distance), but since it was included.... Although the breakfast included the same things each day, it was still fresh and fulfilling. But if you're going to Amsterdam, then Have FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: lolabug
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on the reviews I read here and I was not disappointed! My single room is definitely in the typical european fashion of being about as big as a closet but, everything in it is brand new and very clean. The bed is truly a single bed but the linens are nice with a white duvet (but only one small pillow). The view of the garden is beautiful even in the winter and it is nice to be able to have the window open without it being too noisy. The bathroom is small but has all the standard ammenities. The free wifi internet access in the rooms is also a huge plus. The front desk staff have been very nice and helpful. The location is within walking distance to the mueseums and the tram is very easy to take pretty much anywhere you need to go in the city. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to tourists and business travellers both.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: telco
Reviews.Content: A case of getting exactly what you are promised. Great location, tiny, clean rooms. Great value, at under Euro 80. If you have never seen the 'no bathtub' shower, it's an additional perk. Lift works, rooms get cleaned, nice staff, good lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, little well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: urony
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - if you wish to see amsterdam. Located 2 minutes walk from the museums (Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh), 3 minuted walk to Leidseplein, abd about 15-20 to the Dam. Public tranportaion everywhere is in 1-3 minutes walk. It is in a very quiet street (we stayed ther at new year's eve and it was quite). Nice breakfast, the stuff is nice too. As it is smallit gives a familly atmosphere. True - rooms are small, but cleen and comfprtable. If you came to see the city you don't need much more than a goos bed and good bath. I will return happily.

Reviews.Title: “Well chilled”
Reviews.Author: Analemmatic
Reviews.Content: On arrival, thought it looked a bit minimalist, but found it to be a very relaxed stay in a great city. Just outside the Vondelpark - not much use in December but would be great in summer! Very convenient for Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh, Heineken experience; also for Canal bus at Leidseplein. The bar area was comfortable with Internet access available, relaxed but friendly welcome. No restaurant, but there are plenty of all descriptions near Leidseplein, a short walk, or elsewhere, so this wasn't a problem. We had a great Dutch-style meal at Blonde Hollander (Leidskruisstraat), also nice Italian at Canaletto, just round the corner. Looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Mee65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Piet Hein Hotel in December 2006 for four nights. Our room was clean but was very dark even with all the lights on. The carpet is a very dark colour and the walls were a dark mucky brown colour. It was very difficult to see anything on the floor, for example, black socks. There were about three steps up to the bathroom. The bathroom was fine except that the soap/shampoo dispensers were empty the whole time we were there and not filled up. No other freebie toiletries were supplied. Breakfast was nice and the decor of the room was lovely. The breakfast staff were friendly but they kept asking everyone for their room number every five minutes, I think they kept forgetting who they had already asked! The location of this hotel is pretty good for walking into the main part of Amsterdam (the capital is not very big). The majority of the reception staff were very friendly except for the lady who checked us out. She was a bit abrupt and as soon as she'd updated the computer she just left us and went to talk to someone else. I thought it would have been nice for her to have thanked us for staying or to wish us a safe trip back. Overall, would I stay there again? Probably not, but only because I wasn't that impressed with Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Gabbiano_Gionata
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, close to the centre (about 20 minutes by walk to Dam square 5 minutes by tram), rooms and bathrooms are not too big but clean, a bit of noise in the morning. The hall is too small with the reception, the bar and the tv zone close to each other. Friendly staff always taking care of the clients. Honest price. Positive experience

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: ROARR
Reviews.Content: The Piet Hein is a wonderful hotel with a very friendly staff (including the bar staff). The rooms were small (like most) but very tidy. The most important element, the bed, was very comfortable with soft comforters. The immaculate washroom had an adjustable shower head with strong water pressure. This comes in handy for people that are tall ( 6'-6" like me). The location is within two blocks of the ELITE shopping district and trams that will take you everywhere. If you're into gambling, the casino is a pleasant 5 minute walk through the park. Speaking of Vondel Park, enjoy a beer or sandwich a Cafe Vertigo. The only shortcomings were: The breakfast is VERY basic (but good) and we could only stand it for two days in a row (Get me some Dutch pancakes). The hotels soap is liquid form and I couldn't use it. Plastic cups in the room. Where's the glasses?

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlisonJW
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to the reviews. It is smart with friendly staff, pleasant rooms (although a bit on the small side) and in a good, and quiet, location. Perhaps the only downside is that it's a bit of a walk to the canals, so not as you might imagine a typical Amsterdam hotel to be. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot”
Reviews.Author: 2poc
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research before booking this hotel as accomodation in Amsterdam is seriously pricey. Got a good deal for 5 nights on the web & booked it. Its close to the exclusive area in Amsterdam so lots of lovely shops nearby. Its also close to museums, pubs, public transport & restaurants while far away enough from central Amsterdam to be quiet enough at night. Would definitely recommend it, the only downfall for me being that the breakfast buffet wasnt very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, warm atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: LindaCH
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel Piet Hein after reading several reviews of lots of other hotels in Amsterdam. We were not disappointed. Only a couple of minute's walk away from the Van Gogh museum and round the corner from the tram stop. The staff were friendly and warm and very welcoming. We booked a superior double and were allocated a room at the rear of the hotel overlooking the garden. Spotlessly clean and very comfortable with excellent bathroom. Only downside was the lack of cupboard space - only one wardrobe and no drawers - but as our stay was only for three nights this was not too inconvenient. Breakfast was typical continental fare - in a pleasantly decorated dining room. A real find! We would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay just outside the hubub of the centre of Amsterdam, but still within easy reach of all attractions. Linda and Tony Hibbert, Ashton-under-Lyne, Lancashire

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ColinPett
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Within 5 mintes of 2 tram lines which run very frequently into the city centre or walk for 10 minutes across the park (entrance right on your doorstep!) to the city canals. We stayed in October and hotel busy but rooms remained very quiet. Rooms are on the small side, but true of most hotels in European capitals! Staff very friendly and helpful. Amsterdam is a very 'smokey' city so expect bars and eating places to be smokey. Non smoking areas seem at a real premium! The hotel bar is certainly smokey most evenings. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lclarke
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to visit Amsterdam for a mere 12 hours and this hotel was great. It's in a great (and VERY safe) location with a beautiful park directly in front of the hotel, incredible shopping around the corner and public transportation very close by. The room I was in had two twin beds pushed together and compared to American standards, very small. However, it was immaculate, comfortable and had a great bathroom in the room as well. The staff was very welcoming and helpful, the hotel lobby had internet access (you only pay for the time you use) and though I didn't spend a lot of time here, it was well worth every dollar.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: michwong
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel and booked a superior double. The room was not big but comfortable. The path to the bathroom is quite unique as the bathroom was elevated so you have to take a few steps up (see photos). Room-wise, adding to the previous review - the bed was good, firm and very comfortable. They were generous with pillows, about 4 comfortable pillows on the double bed. The room was clean and we had a window overlooking a quiet backyard/ roof.....the room has no aircond - so it can get slightly stuffy but because it gets quite cool in the night (we were there in early Autumn, late Sept) and we were out most of the day, it didn't bother us much as we left the windows open. But I can imagine it can get quite hot in the summer months and the room gets quite direct sunlight. Otherwise, even with the window open, the room was very quiet, ensuring a good night's rest. The bathroom - very clean and modern. But just some comments - the sink was a little shallow and the tap a bit high, so when you wash up at the sink, water do tend to splash out a little. And the space around the sink area is a little cramped. And there's a soap dispenser which serves as shampoo, shower gel and soap all in one....so if you are not comfortable with that, best to bring your own toiletries, which was what we did so this didn't really bother us. The other thing which we thought was a little on the downside was the shower curtains needs some cleaning. As it's black in colour, we could see quite clearly thick soap/ shampoo stains from the previous guests. The breakfast at the hotel's very good. The spread is good and they've got really yummy eggs (hardboiled though), cereal and muesli, fresh fruit juices, bread sprinkles, cheeses, ham and salami and a good variety of tea and coffee. All served in a lovely cosy breakfast room. We loved and enjoyed the breakfast very much! The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and warm. The hotel is in a good location and we feel safe (no drunks or rowdy people or anything like that) in the area even when we were walking along the streets late at night. The hotel is about 5-10 minutes walk to/ from the tram stop which is just up the street from the Van Gogh Museum and a few minutes walk to some trendy branded shops. It's also very close to Vondelpark and the Rijksmuseum (walking distance). Taking a tram to and from Centraal Station would take approximately 15 minutes or so but it passes by most of the main tourist attractions such as the flower markets, Leidesplein (where there were tonnes of cafes/ restaurants/ bars and near the casino, Hard Rock Cafe). Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CPtraveller
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on recommendations on TripAdvisor.com, and was entirely satisfied with my stay. I arrived at 8:30am in the morning from a flight from the US and they had no problem allowing me to check into a room right away. I had reserved a 'Business Single' room on the hotel website, but I think I received an upgraded double room, and was ultimately charged for only the basic single room. The rooms are not large but are very well maintained and spotlessly clean. The location of the hotel is great, literally across the street from the Vondelpark, and just a couple of minutes walk from canals, trams, Leidseplein, museums, etc. Book online through the hotel's website to get free breakfast included (though the breakfast is nothing to write home about). I would definitely stay here again on a visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “the best value hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: mat27
Reviews.Content: stayed here in Feb, we had a wonderful week. The hotel was comfortable, bathroom really modern and clean with a great shower, beds really comfortable too and the room spacious. The people who worked there were professional, pleasant and really helpful too. Its tucked away near the park so is very quiet too, but near enough to the centre so you've only got a 5 minute walk in. This must be one of the best value hotels in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for short stay”
Reviews.Author: ATV-K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the beginning of August. Right opposite Vondelpark and a short walk to Leidseplein and the Museum Quarters are very close too. That helps as a tourist. The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel rooms, however are quite congested. The dÃ©cor is minimalist, there are no coffee maker or mini bar in the room. The hotel seems slightly overpriced for its short fallings. The place is very well located and perfect for a short stay. ATV- K

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MikeDC
Reviews.Content: Not having been to Amsterdam before I took a chance on booking my stay in a "quiet part of the city." That usually means dull or remote, but nothing could be further from the truth. The Hotel Piet Hein puts you three blocks from the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum, a block from high-end shopping, just across the street from Vondelpark (the city's main park) and just over a canal from the bustling Leidseplein. Plus there's great dining (a bakery, a cafe, a herring stand, a great Indonesian place) right around the corner. We booked a deluxe room (A "superior" room is just their regular room, BTW. Don't think you're getting anything special in a Superior.) in order to assure ourselves of AC and it was great. A nice queen bed (not two twins pushed together) for my wife and I. Friendly, helpful staff. A really modern but comfortable decor. Good breakfast in the morning. A nice little bar to welcome you back from your day exploring too. Can't imagine how hectic and perhaps intimidating the city would have felt if we had stayed near the Dam or Centraal Station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexcat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Piet Hein on July 20 through July 23rd and found it to be a very comfortable hotel. The rooms are small (typical of Europe) and some of them don't have air. It was super hot during my stay and I had booked a single room that did not have air. Luckily, there was a larger room available that had air and they allowed me to change rooms for an additional charge for the larger room. I found the staff to be very helpful & friendly and the location was supurb. I used the hotel recommended taxi service to the airport and found it to be very reasonable priced. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Howden End
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 10 -14 July and was most impressed. Great location - Vondelpark to the front. i had a rear room that opened onto the hotel garden. Clean, well run efficient and helpful staff. Will definately return

Reviews.Title: “A really nice but affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: mzamar
Reviews.Content: Was so pleased with my stay at the Piet Hein mid June of 2006. Entire room was very clean and comfortable (I paid a bit more for 'business class' sized single, which was still small by US standards but not too bad). The hotel has internet service in the lobby which you can charge to your room, several international TV stations in your room and A FABULOUS FABULOUS BREAKFAST with toast, salami, cheese, soft boiled eggs, cereal, juice, tea, coffee, yogurt, fruit,... really comprehensive and delicious. When it rained one day and I asked where I could buy an umbrella, the desk clerk gave me one from the hotel to use free of charge. All staff I met spoke English and were very helpful in pointing me in the next direction to go. Hotel is located just steps from the Van Gogh Museum and the Leidesplein. You can take the #5 Tram from the WTC to and from the Airport. Fabulous stay, would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Suitable”
Reviews.Author: meesheyb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, quiet, and well-located. We were able to walk a few blocks to all major museums, the tram, and the main shopping/eating strip from the hotel. Breakfasts , which were included in our room price, were adequate and there were no surprises when our bill came at the end of our stay - breakfast and taxes are included in the room rate. Only bother was the smallness of the bathroom and the smoke that infiltrated our room from the hallway. Other than that, I would recommend this hotel to tourists visiting Amsterdam. Very convenient and fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Wildpebble
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Piet Hein in March. It was clean & comfortable, the staff were very friendly & helpful. It was well located and the places we visited were easily reached on foot. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to spend time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous staff, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: marisa13
Reviews.Content: I love the Piet Hein and would never consider staying anywhere else in Amsterdam. It's less than a 5-minute walk from the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum, and very convenient from the train station via tram or on foot (about 25 minutes on foot). There are dozens of restaurants within a 5-minute walk, of every kind imaginable, yet the hotel is across from a park and in a very quiet location. The beds are comfortable, the pillows absolutely divine (I was tempted to try to stuff one into my luggage) and the room was so clean it seemed one could eat off any surface. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The only thing I didn't love about the hotel is their noisy doors. If you happen to be next door to guests who love the nightlife, be prepared to be awakened at 3 am or so by a slamming door. The hotel's website, and information given out at the train station, indicates that to get to the hotel you should take tram 2 or 5 and get off at Hobbemastraat. But we found if we waited to get off until the next stop (across the street from the Van Gogh Museum), the walk to the hotel is considerably shorter.

Reviews.Title: “Piet Hein a delightful cocoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was initially skeptical of the Piet Hein, since I was a bit shocked by the small dimensions of the basic single room and problems connecting with the hotels toll wifi network. However, after a night of quiet and undisturbed sleep in a delightfully serene room facing the garden, luxuriating under the down comforter and cocooned in a haven of pillows, I was more inclined to appreciate the benefits of this hotel. Book with the hotel website directly for the best deals, particularly since breakfast is included in the room rate, which isn't the case with some consolidators. The breakfast is quite exceptional, expansive and presented in a gracious and comfortable setting. It compares well with similar offerings at 5 star hotels in the city, or even up the road at the Leidseplein! The staff are friendly and knowledgeable, and I'll forever be thankful to the woman at reception who clued me into the free internet signal available from the very comfortable lobby. The bar/lobby provides a most amenable space either for socializing with friends pre- and post-urban adventures or for getting things done. Extraordinary bargain for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Not particularly outstanding . . . .”
Reviews.Author: prudenceclearwater
Reviews.Content: Given the reviews on this site, I expected way more than this distinctly average to below-average 3-star hotel. In fact, when I asked about a simple amenity, the girl at the desk flipped out and cried, "We are only a 3-star hotel! We are only 3 stars!" The carpets were very dirty, there was a bad smell in the hallways, the bed was uncomfortable, the room was the typical European tiny size, the shower was the usual splash-and-puddle all over the floor, the room was cold and so was the staff. In fact, one of their staff personally told me that they often intentionally left their guests waiting 1-2 hours or longer after their rooms were ready if any remark was made about having to wait at all. This person also told me they enjoyed making those guests wait because there was nowhere to store their luggage in the meantime and their plans would be ruined for hours! I was not surprised so much that this happened but was very surprised at the venom and the glee and the name-calling (generally, stupid idiot guests) . . . . I actually witnessed this occurrence (except for the name-calling) but could not say whether the room was actually unavailable. However, the clerk was not very nice and seemed to enjoy giving the folks the bad news. The location was not terrible but it was a long walk to the main drag. I will probably inquire at the Park Hotel or another the next time I visit Amsterdam. I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Caribbeing
Reviews.Content: Even though I was prepared for a small room, I still was a bit surprised by HOW small it really was, and I had a deluxe. Still, once I dealt with that, I really enjoyed this hotel. The outside of the hotel and the lobby are very stylish. The breakfast room is narrow, but pleasant enough. The room itself was small (as I've said), but the bed was decent, and the TV and other standard elements were sufficient. The location of the hotel is really the best thing - it's an easy walk to Leidesplein, the casino, etc. The hotel is across the street from Vondelspark, so if you have a room that faces that way (I didn't), it's probably a very nice view. I chatted with a couple of the women behind the counter at the hotel, and they were quite friendly, as was the barman. All in all, this is a nice, solid 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here everytime!!”
Reviews.Author: greenbeatle
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, located snugly in between the Park, the Museum district and the centre of town. An easy walk to anywhere, and the tram lines are closeby too. Clean, cosy rooms - ours had a view of the park. The bar downstairs is a great place to prepare for an evening out! The staff are very helpful, speak wonderful English and even let us use the internet without charge when checking in for our flight! Considering the low price, we will most certainly be returning to Piet Hein the next time we stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Good, relatively cheap stay”
Reviews.Author: Clive166
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed at the Hotel Piet Hein in February 2006, purely based upon the recommendations on Tripadvisor. We were looking for a relatively cheap, good quality hotel handy for the sights and sounds of Amsterdam. The Hotel Piet Hein did not disappoint. The hotel room itself was small but well formed, with a good quality bathroom and the breakfast provided was of a good quality too. This was not the best hotel we have ever stayed in (the Hotel Rival in Stockholm would fit that bill) but, for the price, the Piet Hein was not a disappointment at all.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from Hotel Piet Hein last week, We thouroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel was clean, comfortable and friendly and was in a great location! The staff were extremely helpful, and always ready to help. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Piet Hein”
Reviews.Author: tdm1841
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel with a convenient location. Very quiet for a city hotel. Martin, the bartender was wonderful, entertaining, and very helpful. The public rooms are beautiful, the breakfast great, and the rooms nice. A great value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Inveroran
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Piet Hein chosen partly for previous good reviews and partly due to its closeness to the museum area. The room was fine, the breakfast good and we found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The area was very quiet but any action was fairly close. Only negative point was that the room still felt a bit cold despite the air conditioning cranked up. We would still recommend it and will return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: redletter
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 nights at this hotel in Amsterdam. Good for public transport - the 2 and 5 tram takes you straight to Central Station. Great for the Van Gogh and Rikjsmuseum and a short walk into the centre of Amsterdam. The next street has all the designer shores plus a brilliant Italian deli. Vondelpark (adjacent) gives a really interesting snapshot on family life for Amsterdammers - as well as cyclers and joggers. Had a couple of great dinners at the Cafe Americain (5 minutes walk), and Puri Mas (Indonesian) and fab pancackes at Le Soleil (all within walking distance). The staff were very friendly - the guy who runs the bar is good fun and directed us the Joordan district for individual shops where we did all our Christmas shopping. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: jamc204
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for tourists. It is within walking distance of the major museums and streetcars. The staff is very friendly and they gave us good advice on where to visit and where to eat. The hotel serves an excellent buffet breakfast every morning. The only negatives were that our room never got quite warm enough and there were only bottom sheets on the beds - no top sheet to separate you from the bedcover. This hotel is an excellent value and I'd definitely stay there again. Joe

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: surfphoto
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice 3 night stay at the Piet Hein, and we will stay there again when (hopefully) we return to Amsterdamn. At first the staff was a bit cold to us, actually a little insulting regarding our parking situation. They did warm up after our friendly interaction regarding the one problem with our room. It seems that someone left the hotel in haste and forgot to remove their items from the closet. The staff was extremely apologetic and was grateful that we were understanding. Neither my wife nor I though it was a big deal but they certainly did. The breakfast buffet was nice, we had to pay but I think it was worth the money. The hotel bar was very pleasant, and the back garden area was quite nice. Our room overlooked the garden and was quite and comfortable. One sidenote I will make is NEVER drive into Amsterdam. What a waste of money for parking. If you do drive, bring tons of coins for the parking meters. An evening pass will run you @18 euros, all in coin. We did manage to but a full day pass from the hotel which really helped the other two days (@ 31 euro each day).

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: PeanutMandMs
Reviews.Content: We read rave reviews about this place and were very disappointed in what we got as a superior double room. Perhaps they were out of the best rooms and we had the bad luck of being assigned room 121. It did have hot water and heat and CNN. Otherwise, room 121 looks directly out at a brick wall (no trace of a green tree or any other foliage ANYWHERE from our room), the walls inside the room were painted dark brown, not a cozy, inviting place. The bathroom was tiny, barely any room to move inside the shower, no bathtub. If you decide to stay here, make sure you ask for a view and stay away from room 121!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place!”
Reviews.Author: cookiehead
Reviews.Content: We really loved the Hotel Piet Hein. The rooms are very small, but very clean. The bathroom looked fairly new too. One thing we didn't like: You could hear people walking up the stairs at various times of the day. Not sure if the walls are thin or what, but it was kind of annoying. However, it wouldn't keep us from staying there again. Also: Our big bed was 2 little beds pushed together with two blankets. No big deal on that though. It was all above average for the price that we paid. Front sitting area and bar area were very nice. People were friendly too. Breakfast was nothing spectacular, but it was included and more than enough to get you started on your day. Great location too: Within walking distance to a lot of attractions as well as public transportation stops. Definitely would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for a week in mid August. We had a twin delux room which was very clean and nicely decorated. The hotel staff was very helpful in answering all our questions regarding transportation and destinations. The hotel bar was a great place to have a drink at the end of the day. The bartender and front desk clerk provided us with great suggestions for side trips. The location was perfect as we were able to walk to all of the museums and shopping areas. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Cali369
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of weeks ago on a 3-day trip. I had researched the hotel so knew what to expect. We had one twin and one single room for our party and the rooms were fine, small, but you would expect that in an old building in Amsterdam and good value. Both rooms were in the older part of the building (no air con - but the windows open) and we got lucky with one which had french windows and a balcony. Bathrooms (we had one with bath, one with shower) were modern and clean. The lobby and bar area were nicely done and the desk staff couldn't have been more helpful. Breakfast was regular continental fare (yogurt, breads, cheeses, cold cuts, eggs etc) but great for the inclusive price - they even let us have free cups of tea on our arrival. The garden was lovely - a great place to sit and have a cuppa in the morning. Location was great, right opposite Vondel park and a tram stop (and some great shops) within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “We would go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were glad we chose this hotel with the help of this site. Most of the reviews we read were favorable, and we were very pleased with our stay here in mid-June of 2005, especially having an air-conditioned room since all of Europe was experiencing a heat wave. The room was small but clean and comfortable, the location excellent, the staff very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was excellent and served in a very attractive room. We felt that we received excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SteveNorthPalmBeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Piet Hein and loved it. When we arrived, we were given a large room, as I had requested, but it was in the older section of the hotel without air conditioning. Unfortunately, Amsterdam was unusually hot, but the staff kindly moved us to the newer annex to a smaller room that had air conditioning. The location of the hotel on Vondelpark and close to tram stops seems unbeatable. We travelled all over the city with ease and spent lots of time walking in the park. It is a very joyful and active place with happy people having picnics and playing. The staff at the Piet Hein was friendly and we enjoyed the small bar in the lobby area. Martin, the bartender, was especially nice. Amsterdam is a city that accomodates pedestrians and bicyclists, but not motor vehicles. Some construction was going on near the hotel in June 2005 and our taxi driver became quite frustrated getting us to the hotel. He dropped us off a couple of blocks from it and we eventually found it tucked away facing Vondelpark. It was worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Warning of bait-and-switch...”
Reviews.Author: issyK
Reviews.Content: My agent booked me into this hotel during a recent business trip to Amsterdam. Upon arriving, my girlfriend was told that there was a mistake and the hotel was overbooked but reassured that a room was reserved for us in Hotel Europa 92 down the street at the same price. Hotel Europa is not a business-class quality hotel, and the staff at Hotel Piet Hein were shockingly rude when I declined to stay there. They asked me to pay for the room because we had taken the key briefly while looking at the room. This ensued in a heated argument until they finally backed down. I am not sure why Hotel Piet Hein would try to pass off a much lesser hotel at the same price. Perhaps it has something to do with the "close relationship" they claim to have with Hotel Europa. At any rate, just wanted to let other folks know about this potential issue.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from the Hotel Piet Hein and will definitely be returning. The staff were wonderful, very helpful and friendly. The barman was extremely friendly, made us feel really welcome and even treated us to a local drink. The room was bigger than we expected and was clean and tidy with air conditioning. The staff were only too happy to keep hold of our bags after we checked out so we could explore the city a bit more without luggage until it was time to leave for the airport. The hotel is nicely situated, opposite a beautiful park and around the corner from the Van Gough museum. It is a fair walk to the center (although a pleasant one, if you don't get too lost). You can also take a tram (2 or 5) from outside the Van Gough museum which takes you to the center (1.60 euros... pay the driver or get a 10 trip pass from the supermarket) or alternatively you can get a taxi for about 13 - 16 euros. Only negative thing is the breakfast, very basic and bland... shame because everything is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Only minor probs - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: rainbow_girl
Reviews.Content: Hi, Just got back form Amsterdam. The hotel was lovely right next to a park which was great for evening strolls. The hotel is away from the main centre which meant that is was very quiet and peaceful. The room itself was very clean and a good size the bathroom was spotless and a decent size with a bath and power-shower. The breakfast room with clean and the breakfast was simple but nice they served breakfast until 11am which was good. Also i think we were the youngest people staying at the hotel both my partner and I are 23 years old... but that wasnt a bad thing!! The only problems, which were quite small such as the sheets were too small for the bed (they didnt tuck under the matrass) which meant that during the night the sheets collected in the middle of the bed... atleast the matrass was clean! On the last day we had finished having breakfast at 11am and went up to collect our things to leave and we got a call from the reception asking what time we were leaving and if we would hurry up and leave - which was a bit rude seeing that we were half way out the door anyway!! Also the room next door had a balacony so the people would stand on the balancony and make phone calls very loudly. I would have complained but we were only there for three days Apart from these small problems if we went back to Amsterdam we would definatly go back to this hotel. I hope this helps anyone thinking of booking this hotel, it was a lovely hotel and the doors do have locks on them to stop housekeeping from coming in!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent three night at this hotel. We had booked well in advance, and as such were allocated a brilliant room overlooking the park with a terrace. I imangine not all rooms this great, so you may want to ask for it. The location was perfect for our needs, in that we were happy to be a little removed from the complete bustle of the red light district / central station area. This hotel is remarkably close to the Museum district, and has great upscale shopping and non-chain restaurants within a short walk. It is no problem to get downtown by walking or hopping on a tram. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My father, brother, and I stayed at the Hotel Piet Hein in Amsterdam on May 5 and 6, 2005. This hotel has a very comfortable and modern lounge/bar area in the lobby where you can get snacks and use the internet (for a fee). Most of the staff were exceedingly friendly and helpful, except for one female staff member, but the others made up for her snooty attitude. The hotel has a modern lift. Our rooms were the "deluxe" twin and double rooms. They were small indeed, however, they were very clean and ultra-modern. The weather during our stay was very cool and damp, and one of the rooms did not have any heat as the air conditioning was already turned on for the season. We had requested rooms on the upper floors but my room was on a floor where my window was at ground level, but at least it had a hot water heater. The duvets were very warm and comfy. We were able to purchase strip-tickets for the tram at the hotel. To reach the tram stop you had to walk about two blocks along the side of Vondel Park. The location was quite good, within walking distance of the Casino, many restaurants (including Pizza Hut), and the canal tours. I recommend this hotel if you don't mind tiny rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value--but a few kinks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved this hotel at first--friendly staff, great location, good value. But a few things bothered us. On our first day, the housekeeper walked in while we were in the room. She knocked first, but apparently didn't hear us yell that we were inside. Both nights of our stay, I found it tough to sleep because the trams right outside our window were really loud. Finally, the morning we were to leave, we asked for a wake-up call that never came. The room didn't have an alarm clock so we were depending on it. Fortunately I was awake from the trams, but I would have been really upset if we'd missed our train because they missed the wake-up call. Maybe we just had bad luck...apart from these isolated problems, the hotel was comfortable and pleasant.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Piet Hein
HotelInfo.Address: Vossiusstraat 52 - 53, Amsterdam 1071 AK, The Netherlands
